newsitem.title: CHINA: Hong Kong police arrest ex-Merrill banker Wallace.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong police arrest ex-Merrill banker Wallace.

text.p: Kevin Wallace, a former employee of Merrill Lynch suspected of committing fraud, has been arrested by Hong Kong's Commercial Crime Bureau, Hong Kong police said on Tuesday.

"For the case concerning Mr. Kevin Wallace, he was arrested by the Commercial Crime Bureau last night at around half past ten and is now being detained for further enquiries," a police spokesman said.
The spokesman said he did not know for how long Wallace would be detained. Charges will depend on the results of the investigation, he said.
U.S. investment bank Merill Lynch has accused Wallace of engaging in "unauthorised trading, misrepresenting or falsifying private clients' statements and forging client signatures".
Merrill also has said it has started civil proceedings in Singapore and Hong Kong against Wallace and filed a criminal complaint in Singapore.
Merrill has not commented on the amount in question in the case, but industry sources and media reports have estimated that some US$30 million could be involved.
